content.title: Atal Mission For Rejuvenation And Urban Transformation
content.beneficiary: Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) and citizens of selected cities
content.details: The purpose of the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) is to ensure that every household has access to a tap with the assured supply of water and a sewerage connection, increase the amenity value of cities by developing greenery and well-maintained open spaces, and reduce pollution by switching to public transport or constructing facilities for non-motorized transport.
benefits: Water supply systems including augmentation of existing water supply
Rehabilitation of old water supply systems
Recycling of water for beneficial purposes
Construction and improvement of drains and storm water drains
Development of green space and parks
eligibility: Open scheme with no specific eligibility requirements
Applicable to selected cities with a population of over one lakh
content.application_process: The applicant need not apply for the scheme. Projects will be executed by Urban Local Bodies (ULBs).
documents_required: No documents required for the scheme

faqs.question: Is my city listed in the 500 cities selected for AMRUT Mission?
faqs.answer: You can check the list of cities here: http://amrut.gov.in/content/citiescovered_map.php

faqs.question: Can the ULB hire consultant for the SLIP preparation?
faqs.answer: The MoHUA has simplified the process for SLIP preparation and is also hand-holding the cities.

faqs.question: Is there any limit to the project cost for each sector that the ULBs will propose for SLIP?
faqs.answer: No, but the states/ULBs have to give consideration to the National Priorities of the Mission and the Guidelines.

faqs.question: How ULB Will Share 30% In AMRUT?
faqs.answer: The contribution of State Govt is minimum 20%. There is no upper limit on State share in SAAP.

faqs.question: What shall be the general order of prioritization of projects in water and sewerage sector?
faqs.answer: Universal coverage of water supply shall be given top priority.
